definition: at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning

sentences.english: He had made up his mind that Johnson was guilty, and he steamrollered anyone who disagree with him.
sentences.chinese: 他已经认定约翰逊有罪，并迫使任何持异议者就范。

sentences.english: Well we've got the tools to teach you just how to wrangle your databases into submission.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我们得教你的工具是多么缠斗就范数据库。

sentences.english: They tried to starve me out by a sex-trap.
sentences.chinese: 他们妄图以女色迫我就范。

sentences.english: The Sukarno regime will not easily submit itself to the pressure from the USA.
sentences.chinese: 印尼苏加诺政权对于来自美国的压力也不会轻易就范。

sentences.english: The defeated general showed his submission by giving up his sword.
sentences.chinese: 这位败将交出他的佩剑以示就范。

definition: use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to use gain as a lure
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
hands tied and waiting to be captured
a cornered dog will jump over the wall (idiom)/to be driven to desperate action
lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
